channel.title: Help with hosting
channel.description:
Yes, i am clear on the rules, therefore in this topic nowhere will i be asking for a host.
I currently have a modem combo (modem and router all-in-one) that does not allow for portforwarding, so i need help with trying to host a server, not using hamachi. I am VERY new to this sort of thing, as i usually do small snippits of coding, but mainly graphics and modeling work for servers, but as my partners internet is choppy and unfit for hosting, the server needs a host. Therefore i must try to figure it out myself, which is seemingly becomin a larger problem than i anticipated. All in all, i need a way to host a server without portforwarding. ANY HELP WILL BE APPRECIATED.

item.title: Help with hosting
item.dc:creator: @pro_banana pro banana
item.description:
@pro_banana wrote:

iamapker:

ok just wondering are you vista 64bit? cuz its really hard to get a port forwarded on these but i finally got mine if you are 64 i just may be able to help you? if you know all the passwords also i used 2wire modem, so im familiar with that but i might be able to help you out on yours. pm me for more info i probably wont see this thread again

That’s not true being on a 64bit OS has nothing to do with portforwarding :s.

item.title: Help with hosting
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Broken down for dummys

If you have a Modem, Open Firewall
If you have a Router, Port Forward
If you happen to have Both, USE YOUR BRAIN… DO BOTH

  1. Check Your Modem Firewall if it has one
  2. Check Windows Firewall and if needed add a new inbound rule
  3. Make sure that whatever router-like thing you have is directing incoming connections on port 43594 to your IPv4. If its a router it CAN do that.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with hosting
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Pigrear:

1000% positive. I also tried with uTorrent, but i cant seem to get it… I checked my ports, and the UDP is open, but not the TCP. Its possible im doing it wrong. Also im running Vista if thats info you needed.

Modem = Open Firewall
Router = Port Forward
Both = Use that pink mushy thing in your head. I do believe its called a brain.

  1. Check Your Modem Firewall if it has one
  2. Check Windows Firewall and if needed add a new inbound rule
  3. Make sure that whatever router-like thing you have is directing incoming connections on port 43594 to your IPv4. If its a router it CAN do that.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with hosting
item.dc:creator: @pl0x15 pl0x15
item.description:
@pl0x15 wrote:

Guys, don’t diss him. My router was also impossible to portforward it was a special type of linksys which only had 10 portforwarding slots. And correct me if I’m wrong you need 11 which I clearly read in SEVERAL tuts. Even in the pic on the tut of google they had 11 slots, yet i had 10:( I made 1 through a static ip at my fathers house. Sent the files over here, used the Duc20/no-ip account and hosted it. Now standing today, is my static ip server which runs on my computer with the fk3d up router but not portforwarded through my router. So thats a way you could do it. Go to a friends house with a static ip. (basically intenret through a cable box) also the ip will most likely start with 64.—.---.-- (meaning the 64 will be first 2 numbers depending on cable box. U download a source, run the source and check through a status checker the ip through ur no-ip account that u setup using the static ip. (it will work if done correctly, Then go to YOUR house where u have the router, download no-ip (using the account same as friends house or whereever. Check the box of the no-ip that u made with the static ip. Call ur friend, tell him to close the source. U run a source, and BOOM you’re hosting. (if this is to confusing, contact me.) go to runelocus and type in yoshi on search and go to the chatbox and i will help u there, (<---- that was technically not adverting, but a way to contact me. So you can’t report.:))

Read full topic

technically wrong section because portforwarding is not on a server based topic
[/quote]

IM NOT FUCKING ASKING HOW TO PORTFORWARD, I KNOW HOW TO, IVE DONE IT ON A FRIENDS COMPUTER. I KNOW I PHYSICALLY CANT DO IT WITH MY SETUP. POST SOMETHING HELPFUL OR NOT AT ALL, KTHXBAI.

Yes, it is possible to have a modem-router combo, i have one, and i know the paasword for it. Also yes you need both the udp and tcp ports to be open for it to work.[/quote]
Wow strange case could you tell me the name of the router-modem combo?

item.title: Help with hosting
item.dc:creator: @Pigrear Pigrear
item.description:
@Pigrear wrote:

Thickertech:

technically wrong section because portforwarding is not on a server based topic

IM NOT FUCKING ASKING HOW TO PORTFORWARD, I KNOW HOW TO, IVE DONE IT ON A FRIENDS COMPUTER. I KNOW I PHYSICALLY CANT DO IT WITH MY SETUP. POST SOMETHING HELPFUL OR NOT AT ALL, KTHXBAI.

Yes, it is possible to have a modem-router combo, i have one, and i know the paasword for it. Also yes you need both the udp and tcp ports to be open for it to work.
